messages.subject: Re:Anarchist links
messages.msgSnippet: Ok here s a few. Like unschooling you really do have to read a lot,seperate the wheat from the chaff and think a lot before you get it :) This one is a sort
messages.messageBody:
Ok here's a few. Like unschooling you really do have to read a lot,seperate
the wheat from the chaff and think a lot before you 'get it' :)

This one is a sort of reasonably good intro although I haven't read it all.
http://www.geocities.com/Athens/5362/

Something a little more academic, read the intro bit first.
http://flag.blackened.net/ias/

Something more practical. Food politics what you can do, collectives,
co-operatives etc etc. NOT to be confused with the incredibly silly book
(from the 70's I think)of a similar or same name about bomb making! :S
http://www.practicalanarchy.org/

Site with ten tons of links
http://www.infoshop.org

An issue I'm interested in
http://www.tlio.org.uk/

Multi lingual site
http://www.ainfos.ca/

Anarcha-feminist site, good links
http://www.geocities.com:0080/Paris/2159/anrfem.html

It's really frustrating but I've lost the link to the virtual version of a
friends anarchist publication. Will post it when I get it from him (if
that's OK?) One thing is for certain though in that unlike political parties
we're not all singing from the same song sheet. A good thing in my eyes
anyway but just so you are aware of that.

HTH Elaine :)
